item.title: Project 1
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

item.title: Python and R
item.description: This semester, we've learned how to code in two important languages: Python and R! Reticulate allows us to connect the two. With the reticulate package, we are able to run python code in R studio. Here I demonstrate how to load the reticulate package so that we can start using python code. library(reticulate) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidyr) Two significant and useful packages that we've used in python this semester are pandas and numpy.
